perturbation.original_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.22. USER shall mean a single person who accesses and views a Site whether
directly from a web browser or through a Link.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.  DEFINITIONS
     1.22. USER shall mean a single person who accesses and views a Site whether
directly from a web browser or through a Link.

2.5 Impresse hereby grants to VerticalNet a non-exclusive,
non-transferable, royalty-free, right and license to link to the Impresse Area
of the Co-Branded Site. Impresse shall permit Qualified Users who access the Co-Branded
Site to access and use Co-Branded Content from the Co-Branded Site for the
personal use of such Users in accordance with the then-current terms of
Impresse's standard license agreement governing the use of such Co-Branded
Content. Qualified Users are defined as those who have previously purchased commercial printing services from Impresse.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'USER' is broad (anyone who views a site). The modified Section 2.5 introduces 'Qualified Users' but does not explicitly define them in the definitions section. Qualified Users are now those who have purchased services, creating uncertainty about the rights afforded to regular vs. qualified users and whether those who only view the website but didn't purchase anything still qualify as 'USER'

perturbation.original_text:
4.   THE COMMERCIAL TERMS
     4.3. BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT. During the Term of this
Agreement, Impresse agrees to purchase from VerticalNet Banners and
Newsletters for a total price of at least $[*] as set forth below in this
Section 4.3  [BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT]. All prices for such Banners and Newsletters shall be offered to
Impresse at a [*]% discount off of VerticalNet's then current prices for
similar Banners or Newsletters. All purchases shall be subject to
VerticalNet's standard terms and conditions governing advertising on
VerticalNet Sites. Impresse agrees to purchase at least $[*] of such Banners
and Newsletters in each calendar quarter after the Effective Date until a
total of $[*] have been purchased, provided, the total dollar amount
purchased by Impresse in any calendar quarter shall not consist of greater
than 70% of either Banners or Newsletters. Payment of the fees set forth in
this Section shall be made pursuant to the terms of Section 4.5  [PAYMENT TERMS].
perturbation.changed_text:
4.   THE COMMERCIAL TERMS
     4.3. BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT. During the Term of this
Agreement, Impresse agrees to purchase from VerticalNet Banners and
Newsletters for a total price of at least $[*] as set forth below in this
Section 4.3  [BANNER/NEWSLETTER PURCHASE COMMITMENT]. All prices for such Banners and Newsletters shall be offered to
Impresse at a [*]% discount off of VerticalNet's then current prices for
similar Banners or Newsletters. All purchases shall be subject to
VerticalNet's standard terms and conditions governing advertising on
VerticalNet Sites. Impresse *may* agree to purchase at least $[*] of such Banners
and Newsletters in each calendar quarter after the Effective Date until a
total of $[*] have been purchased, provided, the total dollar amount
purchased by Impresse in any calendar quarter shall not consist of greater
than 70% of either Banners or Newsletters. Payment of the fees set forth in
this Section shall be made pursuant to the terms of Section 4.5  [PAYMENT TERMS].
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'agrees to purchase' to '*may* agree to purchase' creates a contradiction because the beginning of the section states Impresse 'agrees to purchase' a total amount. This creates an ambiguity as to whether the quarterly purchase commitment is mandatory or optional.

perturbation.original_text:
6.   DISPUTE RESOLUTION
     6.5. TWO YEAR LIMITATION. Except for claims under Sections 9.4  [INDEMNIFICATION BY IMPRESSE] and 9.5  [INDEMNIFICATION BY VERTICALNET]
hereof, neither party may bring a claim or action regardless of form, arising
out of or related to this Agreement, including any claim of fraud or
misrepresentation, more than two years after the cause of action accrues or
becomes known, whichever is later.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.   DISPUTE RESOLUTION
     6.5. TWO YEAR LIMITATION. Except for claims under Sections 9.4  [INDEMNIFICATION BY IMPRESSE] and 9.5  [INDEMNIFICATION BY VERTICALNET]
hereof, neither party may bring a claim or action regardless of form, arising
out of or related to this Agreement, including any claim of fraud or
misrepresentation, more than one year after the cause of action accrues or
becomes known, whichever is later. In cases of gross negligence and malfeasance, the limitation is extended to five years.
perturbation.explanation: The initial statement in section 6.5 sets a two-year limitation for claims. Adding 'more than one year' but then saying the limitation is 'extended to five years' for specific cases creates a contradiction. Which limitation applies and under what conditions is now ambiguous, leading to uncertainty.
